title: Jackie 'O' Henderson 'wants a full-time TV career WITHOUT Kyle Sandilands'
text:
After 20 years with her partner in crime, Kyle Sandilands, radio personality Jackie 'O' Henderson is reportedly ready to go solo.

The 44-year-old is considering a TV career without Kyle, following the surprise success of The Masked Singer Australia.

According to Woman's Day, Jackie now realises 'she can perform well' without her KIIS FM co-host and wants to broaden her horizons.

Going solo! Jackie 'O' Henderson (pictured) reportedly wants a TV career without her longtime radio partner Kyle Sandilands, as The Masked Singer delivers blockbuster ratings

'She's got her sights set on full-time TV,' said the insider. 'She likes the idea of a new challenge and wants to conquer [television].'

The Masked Singer has delivered consistently strong ratings so far this season, drawing around a million metro viewers per episode.

Prior to this, Jackie had struggled to find decent television roles and was involved in a string of forgettable flops.

End of an era? A source told Woman's Day that Jackie now realises 'she can perform well' without Kyle (pictured) and wants to broaden her horizons

Some of her unsuccessful projects included Undercover Angels (2002), Australian Princess (2005) and The Nation (2007).

She and Kyle infamously co-hosted Big Brother in 2008, replacing Gretel Killeen, and oversaw a significant decline in ratings.

In 2011, the radio presenters had yet another crack at television glory with Kyle and Jackie O's Night with the Stars.

Whoops! Kyle and Jackie infamously co-hosted Big Brother in 2008, replacing Gretel Killeen, and oversaw a significant decline in ratings. Pictured on June 15, 2008

Despite having The X Factor as a strong lead-in, a million viewers switched off within five minutes of the show beginning.

TV Tonight editor David Knox summed up the show perfectly by saying: 'As television, it made good radio.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted KIIS FM for comment.
description: After 20 years with her partner in crime, Kyle Sandilands, radio personality Jackie 'O' Henderson is reportedly ready to go solo.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
